item.title: Something
item.description: Let $X=\coprod_{i\in I}X_i$ be a basis. $\mathcal{T}(X)$ is the topology generated by $X$. We call it the disjoint union topology. I have some other latex tests: Inline: $z = x + y$. Normal block: $$a^2 + b^2 = c^2$$ Matrix: $$\begin{vmatrix}a & b\\ c & d \end{vmatrix}=ad-bc$$ Complicated test: $$ \begin{array} {lcl} L(p,w_i) &=& \dfrac{1}{N}\Sigma_{i=1}^N(\underbrace{f_r(x_2 \rightarrow x_1 \rightarrow x_0)G(x_1 \longleftrightarrow x_2)f_r(x_3 \rightarrow x_2 \rightarrow x_1)}_{sample\, radiance\, evaluation\, in\, stage2} \\\\\\ &=& \prod_{i=3}^{k-1}(\underbrace{\dfrac{f_r(x_{i+1} \rightarrow x_i \rightarrow x_{i-1})G(x_i \longleftrightarrow x_{i-1})}{p_a(x_{i-1})}}_{stored\,in\,vertex\, during\,light\, path\, tracing\, in\, stage1})\dfrac{G(x_k \longleftrightarrow x_{k-1})L_e(x_k \rightarrow x_{k-1})}{p_a(x_{k-1})p_a(x_k)}) \end{array} $$

item.title: Hello
item.description: How to create a new post So, on your computer, cd to the folder in terminal. Then type hugo new posts/<name>.md to create a new post. Edit it as you wish. Finally, in your terminal, git add . , git commit -m "<text>", and git push.
